intro: Spigelia valenzuelae, commonly known as the Valenzuela's spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of bright red, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Spigelia valenzuelae is often found in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests.
